brief_description: When we first meet Abigail Masham (Emma Stone) in The Favourite (2018), she’s covered in mud after being kicked from a carriage. It’s a humble start, but as she climbs Queen Anne’s (Olivia Colman) court her costumes become increasingly lavish.

constellations_primary.name: Making films in black and white
constellations_primary.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

description: Abigail Masham (Emma Stone) is down on her luck. Her wealthy family has made bad investments, and when we first meet her in The Favourite (2018), she’s pleading (politely) for a job in Queen Anne’s palace. It’s not the most flattering start – she’s covered in mud after being kicked from a carriage – but she’s soon promoted to lady-in-waiting and trades her grubby attire for a sleek black dress. As she climbs up the court, more and more white is added to her outfit, demonstrated by the trim on this costume. By the end of the film she’s draped in a completely over-the-top white dress that establishes her influence and shows how far she’s come.
